lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Dongji_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Dongji.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Dongji.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name

* negative value if this object is earlier than the other object,
* and 0 if they are the same.
* Returns whether the input string is a valid date and time
* Returns whether the input string is a valid date and time with time
